evidence.text: 20 | 2025-01-15 | Redacted BRIEF Regarding Applicability of Ricci v. DeStefano to Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree. (Attachments: # 1 Exhibit 1 - Scherbaum Declaration, ...)
The United States has determined not to proceed further in this matter.

12 | 2024-12-20 | ORDER granting 10 Motion to Stay is GRANTED and that all case management deadlines, including the United States' deadline to serve the Summons and Complaint on the City of Durham, are stayed pending the courts resolution of the Parties' Joint Motion for Provisional Approval and Entry of Consent Decree. Signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 12/20/2024. (at) (Entered: 12/20/2024)

evidence.text: 17 | 2025-01-15 | ORDER signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025, that the motion (Doc. 13 ) is GRANTED. The word limit for the briefing the court requested regarding the applicability of Ricci v. Destefano, 557 U.S. 557 (2009), (Minute Entry Dec. 16, 2014), is increased to 9,000 words. (cc) (Entered: 01/15/2025)

extracted.value: ORDER granting Consent MOTION to Exceed Word Limit signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 2025-01-15, increasing the word limit for briefing on Ricci v. Destefano to 9,000 words

evidence.text: 18 | 2025-01-15 | ORDER that the motion 14 is GRANTED in that American Alliance for Equal Rights is granted leave to file its brief as amicus curiae as a separate document forthwith. The court reserves decision on whether the Alliance shall be granted leave to present argument at any future hearing. See L.R. 7.5(f). Signed by JUDGE THOMAS D. SCHROEDER on 01/15/2025. (at) (Entered: 01/15/2025)
